concept.title: Waveform Properties
concept.shortdesc: Understanding the characteristics and behavior of audio waveforms.

section.title: Basic Waveform Types
section.p: Audio waveforms come in several basic forms:

ul.li: Sine waves: The purest form of sound, containing a single frequency
Square waves: Characterized by abrupt transitions between extremes
Triangle waves: Linear transitions between peaks and troughs
Sawtooth waves: Rapid rise followed by sudden drop in amplitude

section.title: Complex Waveforms
section.p: Most natural sounds consist of complex waveforms that combine multiple frequencies and harmonics. These can be analyzed using Fourier analysis, which breaks down complex waves into their constituent sine waves.

section.title: Harmonic Content
section.p: Harmonics are integer multiples of a fundamental frequency that contribute to a sound's timbre. The relative strength of different harmonics gives different instruments their distinctive sounds.
